CWEs: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
description: The function unique_name_424 does not validate or sanitize the input it receives. This can lead to an SQL Injection attack if the input is crafted in a certain way. The function also uses the match method with a regular expression, which can be exploited to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) attack by providing a specially crafted string that takes a long time to process.
